title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

10:03 <asyd> hello there  
10:03 <asyd> jvdrean: you are the author of the ldap extension right? :p  
10:04 <+tmortagne> asyd: if you are talking about ldap authenticator I am, if it's about ldap admin UI on extension.xwiki.org it's jvelociter  
10:05 <asyd> ah well, I have few remarks on the ldap authenticator. It can be nice you support group membership by memberOf and isMemberOf on the user's attribute, rather search for user's dn in groups  
10:06 <+tmortagne> asyd: i'm pretty sure there is a jira issue about that, let me find it  
10:06 <asyd> ok!  
10:07 <asyd> and about the ldap admin ui, i'm not sure to understand its goal. it is a frontend to the xwiki.cfg ldap configuration?  
10:08 <+tmortagne> asyd: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-2853  
10:08 <+tmortagne> asyd: no i think it's saving configuration in XWikiPreferences  
10:08 <asyd> ok  
10:08 <+tmortagne> so for the wiki only and not the whole farm  
10:09 <+tmortagne> (but not 100% sure, did not really used it)  
10:09 <asyd> ok

12:52 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki

12:58 <Chami1> has left #xwiki  
13:14 <rrodriguez> has quit  
13:17 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
13:28 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
13:44 <@cjdelisle> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/WikiEditorImprovements2011  
13:45 <@cjdelisle> interesting project, I didn't see it originally  
13:46 <@cjdelisle> I have long thought it would be really nice if I could ckeck a box and when I typed into the wiki editor the page updated with ajax so I can see my formatting as I type it.  
13:47 <pulasthi> cjdelisle hi  
13:47 <@cjdelisle> howdy  
13:47 <kasun> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: so how did my proposal look :)  
13:49 <@cjdelisle> I have to take another look. The killer question is "will it work"  
13:50 <pulasthi> didnt get u ?  
13:51 <@cjdelisle> Engineering problem. Have to figure out how to make everything fit \_and\_ have good performance when it's all done.  
13:51 <pulasthi> well the aim of the project is to try that out right  
13:52 <pulasthi> im pretty confident i can get it working :)  
13:52 <@cjdelisle> I wrote up some problems which we will face when redesigning storage  
13:52 <@cjdelisle> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Drafts/Storage+4.0+Design+Considerations  
13:52 <@cjdelisle> And some proposed solutions although I don't think they are the best solutions  
13:53 <pulasthi> hmm im hoping to work with cassandra a bit in these days  
13:53 <pulasthi> get things running  
13:54 <@cjdelisle> I have a toy implementation in my git repo  
13:55 <@cjdelisle> https://github.com/cjdelisle/  
13:55 <@cjdelisle> it's in there somewhere  
13:55 <pulasthi> cool il take a look  
13:55 <@cjdelisle> you should be able to just mvn clean install and see it happen  
13:56 <pulasthi> k  
13:56 <@cjdelisle> There are problems with the underlying code which we will have to address.  
13:57 <@cjdelisle> It throws an error when you do a query for something that's not indexed  
13:57 <pulasthi> by code u ur reffring to?  
13:58 <@cjdelisle> the datanucleus cassandra plugin  
13:59 <pulasthi> ahh  
13:59 <pulasthi> hasent anyone reported it already  
13:59 <@cjdelisle> I think it's known  
13:59 <@cjdelisle> It's just that it will cause a lot of trouble for us.  
13:59 <@sdumitriu> pulasthi: Please try not to use abbreviations when talking  
14:01 <pulasthi> sdumitriu : ok, sorry i'll make sure not to use them again  
14:01 <pulasthi> :)  
14:01 <pulasthi> thanks for the advice  
14:01 <@sdumitriu> You're welcome  
14:01 <@cjdelisle> s/You're/You are/  
14:02 <@cjdelisle> hehe  
14:02 <@sdumitriu> Just that speaking correctly shows maturity and attention  
14:02 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Yeah, you are really funny, mister...  
14:02 <@sdumitriu> :)  
14:03 <pulasthi>  cjdelisle: arent the datanucleus people providing a patch for that issue  
14:03 <pulasthi> :-/  
14:04 <@cjdelisle> The cassandra plugin is developed by Todd Nine, not the DN people.  
14:04 <pulasthi> ahh  
14:04 <@cjdelisle> https://github.com/tnine/Datanucleus-Cassandra-Plugin  
14:05 <pulasthi>  cjdelisle: yep i have visited that link but never payed much attention to the author. my bad :)  
14:07 <pulasthi>  cjdelisle: so hopefully ill get cassandra running by the end of the day and i'll try out your implemantaion  
14:07 <pulasthi> :)  
14:07 <@cjdelisle> my code boots cassandra on it's own  
14:08 <pulasthi> ahh so i can start stright away from ur code  
14:08 <pulasthi> \*your  
14:08 <@cjdelisle> yes  
14:09 <pulasthi> ok thanks  
14:09 <@cjdelisle> If you have my toy implementation and you have maven installed you can start cassandra and play with it.  
14:09 <pulasthi> c ya  
14:09 <@cjdelisle> see you  
14:09 <pulasthi> oops again see you  
14:09 <pulasthi> :)  
14:09 <@cjdelisle> aol :P  
14:10 <@sdumitriu> http://www.catb.org/~esr/faqs/hacker-howto.html#teach\_hack  
14:11 <@sdumitriu> "First, we've found that people who are lazy or careless in their writing are usually too lazy and careless in their thinking to make good hackers — so take care to spell correctly, and use good grammar and punctuation, otherwise you'll probably be ignored."  
14:12 <@sdumitriu> This one is cool, too: "When I compared trying to learn to hack under Windows to trying to learn to dance while wearing a body cast, I wasn't kidding."  
14:14 <@cjdelisle> this is also a good one (esp for people who are unfamiliar with IRC) http://www.catb.org/~esr/faqs/smart-questions.html  
14:15 <@sdumitriu> Indeed  
14:16 <@cjdelisle> I was thinking of adding that to the IRC page since a lot of people are too nervous to ask a question into the channel and they just don't know tha PMing is rude.  
14:16 <pulasthi> has quit  
14:18 <@sdumitriu> Yeah, I tend to ignore PMs  
14:18 <@cjdelisle> /mode <yournick> +g  
14:18 <@cjdelisle> don't have to close the windows then  
14:32 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
14:42 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
14:46 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:49 <kasun> has quit  
14:54 <@cjdelisle> I totally just made all of that up without asking, everyone feel free to modify or remove it.  
14:57 <@sdumitriu> Looks good  
14:58 <@cjdelisle> I didn't bother to mention AOLspeak since it's so rare for people asking questions.  
15:01 <@sdumitriu> The worst thing we did with our errors (in xwiki-core) was to have that XWikiException class, with the oh-so-uniformative numbers:  
15:01 <@sdumitriu> Exception 34012  in 3021  
15:01 <@sdumitriu> People just give that line, thinking it's actually very useful, while in reality nobody really knows what those number mean, without looking deeply in the code  
15:02 <@cjdelisle> we could just remove that from the exception message, it doesn't really do anything anyway.  
15:02 <@cjdelisle> Nobody ever uses it AFAIK  
15:06 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: just to make sure: there is no way to "checkout" subtree of a git repository ?  
15:07 <+tmortagne> to have to clone it all, right ?  
15:07 <@sdumitriu> Right  
15:07 <+tmortagne> trying to build just one of the platform projects in jenkins  
15:07 <@sdumitriu> You can extract a subtree from it, once you have it locally, but you can't checkout something inside a repository  
15:08 <+tmortagne> ok  
15:15 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Do you know why using println inside a method of a Groovy class doesn't print in the macro output?  
15:15 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: nop, it should AFAIK  
15:15 <+tmortagne> pretty sure we have unit tests using println  
15:15 <+tmortagne> ha groovy class maybe not  
15:15 <+tmortagne> read to quickly  
15:16 <+tmortagne> sounds like a groovy jsr223 engine bug  
15:16 <+tmortagne> do you get the output somewhere ?  
15:16 <+tmortagne> in the console ?  
15:17 <@sdumitriu> Don't have access to it  
15:18 <@sdumitriu> I'll try locally  
15:21 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Indeed, println inside the class prints to the console  
15:22 <@sdumitriu> Any ideas?  
15:23 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: ok so that means the engine does not take into account scriptcontext output configuration when in a class for some reason  
15:23 <+tmortagne> except a bug in the groovy engine i don't have much idea  
15:24 <+tmortagne> problem is that the engine is done by groovy itself so we will have to report it to them  
15:28 <@cjdelisle> is it a static method?  
15:28 <@sdumitriu> No  
15:28 <@cjdelisle> hmm. This uses it http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Filesystem+Attachment+Porter  
15:28 <@cjdelisle> and it works  
15:31 <@sdumitriu> But that's not a class method  
15:32 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
15:32 <@sdumitriu> It's a local method  
15:32 <@sdumitriu> And that works for me as well  
15:35 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: are testing on trunk ?  
15:36 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
15:37 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
16:05 <rrodriguez> has quit  
16:07 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
16:07 <rrodriguez> has quit  
16:07 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
16:21 <AndreasJ1nsson> has quit  
16:22 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: what's the plan with xwiki-platform-web? Do we want 2 modules: resources(JS+CSS) + distribution or one module like we had before, in which case xwiki-platform-web should be merged with its only remaining child: "standard". I'd like to make one of these changes asap. wdyt?  
16:25 <@sdumitriu> At least two modules  
16:25 <@sdumitriu> But I'm not sure if someone is available to make the move  
16:27 <+mflorea> I'll merge xwiki-platform-web with standard to have it working and then we'll see how we split it in multiple modules  
16:32 <@sdumitriu> +  
16:32 <@sdumitriu> +1

18:16 <ihalip> has joined #xwiki  
18:20 <happysri> has joined #xwiki  
18:20 <modulistic> has joined #xwiki  
18:22 <lucaa> has quit  
18:23 <ihalip> has quit  
18:23 <ihalip> has joined #xwiki  
18:34 <rstavro> has joined #xwiki  
18:36 <rstavro> has left #xwiki  
18:36 <+mflorea> tmortagne: platform-web is now inheriting junit and jmock test dependencies from platform-core and this makes the build fail because platform-web uses maven enforcer plugin to ensure these jars don't go inside the generated war. Do you have any hints on how to exclude these parent dependencies?  
18:38 <+mflorea> I searched a bit and someone suggests on a forum to declare these dependencies as runtime in the child pom. I haven't tried  
18:42 <+tmortagne> you should not need to exclude them  
18:43 <+tmortagne> if you get them it's because they don't use the proper scope  
18:43 <+tmortagne> they are supposed to use <scope>test</scope>  
18:44 <+tmortagne> mflorea: what dependency comes with junit ?  
18:44 <+mflorea> tmortagne: they are inherited, they don't come as a transitive dependency  
18:45 <+tmortagne> ha right  
18:45 <+tmortagne> but even that they should use the right scope  
18:45 <+mflorea> mvn dependency:tree show them at the first level, and they are not declared in the pom  
18:45 <+tmortagne> hmm but you should not inherit them AFAIK  
18:45 <fmancinelli1> has joined #xwiki  
18:45 <fmancinelli> has quit  
18:45 <+tmortagne> let me check core pom  
18:45 <+mflorea> but I think the scope is right in core  
18:46 <+tmortagne> it's using <scope>test</scope>  
18:46 <+tmortagne> si you will not get them in the war  
18:46 <+tmortagne> enforcer is not very clever...  
18:47 <+mflorea> yep  
18:47 <+mflorea> it doesn't have to many options either  
18:48 <+mflorea> I can't configure it to ban only junit from transitive dependencies  
18:48 <+tmortagne> hmm  
18:50 <+tmortagne> the alternative is to remove them from core parent pom, for most of the project it's ok I guess since they get them from xwiki-platform-test or xwiki-commons-test  
18:50 <fmancinelli1> has quit  
18:51 <+mflorea> wait  
18:51 <+tmortagne> we could maybe write a custom rule  
18:51 <+mflorea> it looks like I can exclude junit and include only junit with scope test  
18:52 <+tmortagne> did not checked the detail but seems it's possible  
18:52 <+tmortagne> ha  
18:52 <+mflorea> since scope test is not packaged  
18:52 <+mflorea> let me try  
18:54 <+tmortagne> custom rule would make use write an extension, let not add another project that has to be built alone ;)  
18:55 <+mflorea> :)  
18:55 <ankur> has joined #xwiki  
18:56 <+tmortagne> mflorea: i think you can exclude stuff with scope build  
18:57 <+tmortagne> i mean compile  
18:57 <+tmortagne> since i can see we have  
18:57 <+tmortagne> <exclude>javax.servlet:servlet-api:\*:\*:compile</exclude>  
18:57 <+mflorea> yes, but maybe it comes with a different scope  
18:57 <+tmortagne> you can list several  
18:57 <+tmortagne> there is not infinite number of scopes  
18:58 <+tmortagne> compile is the default one  
18:58 <+tmortagne> it should be enough  
18:58 <+tmortagne> you can also add runtime to be safe  
18:58 <+mflorea> sure, but right now I'm trying to exclude all and include only scope:test  
18:58 <ihalip> has quit  
18:58 <+tmortagne> but i don't see anyone adding a runtime dependency to junit...  
18:59 <+tmortagne> other scopes should not be resolved as transitive dependencies  
18:59 <ankur> has quit  
19:02 <+mflorea> tmortagne: it works with exclude all + include only scope:test. do you prefer to exclude only scope:compile?  
19:02 <+tmortagne> mflorea: you choice, result is the same  
19:03 <+tmortagne> s/you/your/  
19:03 <+mflorea> I'll leave the exclude+include for now  
19:03 <+tmortagne> just fixed tha last thing that made jenkins fail to build platform  
19:04 <+mflorea> I'm committing the platform-web change  
19:04 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: you should be able to find wiki-manager on snapshot repository once current platform build it finished on jenkins
